security: The document is marked 'ADMINISTRATIVE - INTERNAL USE ONLY' and 'Background Use Only - Do Not Reproduce,' suggesting sensitivity regarding internal administrative procedures. Disclosing this document could reveal internal security protocols and practices related to employee retirement, potentially compromising the CIA’s ability to manage information security.
summary: An interview report documents a security briefing with Charlotte Bustos-Videla upon her retirement from the CIA, covering her responsibilities, data ownership, security regulations, and communication protocols.
summary_one_paragraph: This interview report, dated December 30, 1977, details a security debriefing conducted with Charlotte Bustos-Videla (LA GS-14) upon her retirement from the CIA. The interview, conducted by Thomas A. Gaines, covered all phases of security relevant to Bustos-Videla’s responsibilities, emphasizing that all information compiled by the agency is official U.S. government property. Bustos-Videla was reminded of the continued applicability of security regulations and secrecy agreements, including restrictions on divulging intelligence, operational, and administrative information, even to cleared personnel in other government agencies. The report concludes by informing Bustos-Videla that she may contact the agency for guidance on security matters post-retirement.
title: Interview Report: Charlotte Bustos-Videla Retirement
